title: GitHub Actions CI Build Fix
details:
## GitHub Actions CI Build Failure Resolution

### Problem
The GitHub Actions CI build was failing while local builds succeeded. Analysis revealed the failure was due to static code analysis errors from `dotnet format --verify-no-changes --severity error`.

### Root Cause
1. **Code Formatting Issues**: Multiple whitespace formatting violations, encoding problems, and import ordering issues detected by dotnet format
2. **Release Build Configuration Issues**: `SelfContained=true` setting in Release configuration was causing build errors related to RuntimeIdentifier requirements

### Solution Applied
1. **Fixed Code Formatting**: 
   - Ran `dotnet format src/c-sharp/NotebookAutomation.sln` to automatically fix all formatting issues
   - Resolved whitespace, encoding (CHARSET), and import ordering (IMPORTS) violations
   - Fixed issues in files like LoggingService.cs, ILoggingService.cs, PromptTemplateService.cs, and various test files

2. **Fixed CLI Project Configuration**:
   - Removed `PublishSingleFile` and `SelfContained` properties from Release configuration 
   - These properties were causing the build system to look for RuntimeIdentifier during regular builds
   - Publish operations still work correctly when explicitly specifying these properties

### Verification
- ✅ `dotnet format --verify-no-changes --severity error` now passes cleanly
- ✅ Release build (`dotnet build --configuration Release`) works successfully
- ✅ All tests pass in Release configuration (257 passed, 2 skipped)
- ✅ Publish operations still work with explicit PublishSingleFile/SelfContained settings

### CI Build Impact
This fix resolves the CI build failure and ensures that:
- Static code analysis step will pass
- Release builds work correctly in CI environment
- All formatting standards are enforced consistently
